017package org.microbean.invoke;
018
019import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
020import java.util.Objects;
021import java.util.Optional;
022
023import java.util.function.BiFunction;
024import java.util.function.Consumer;
025import java.util.function.Function;
026import java.util.function.Predicate;
027import java.util.function.Supplier;
028
029import java.util.stream.Stream;
030
031import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
032import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingDiscouraged;
033
034/**
035 * A {@link Supplier} that is {@link Optional}-like, and a convenient
036 * {@linkplain #optional() bridge to <code>Optional</code> objects}.
037 *
038 * <p>Unlike {@link Optional}, any implementation of this interface is
039 * not a <a
040 * href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based
041 * class</a>.  This is also why there are no {@code isPresent()} or
042 * {@code isEmpty()} methods.</p>
043 *
044 * @param <T> the type of value implementations of this interface
045 * {@linkplain #get() supply}
046 *
047 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
048 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
049 *
050 * @see #get()
051 *
052 * @see #optional()
053 */
054@FunctionalInterface
055public interface OptionalSupplier<T> extends Supplier<T> {
056
057  /**
058   * Returns either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
059   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
060   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object)} method on the
061   * supplied {@code handler} if a {@link RuntimeException} does
062   * occur.
063   *
064   * @param handler the exception handler; must not be {@code null}
065   *
066   * @return either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
067   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
068   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object)} method on the
069   * supplied {@code handler} if a {@link RuntimeException} does occur
070   *
071   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
072   * null}
073   *
074   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}
075   *
076   * @idempotency This method is not guaranteed to be idempotent or
077   * deterministic.
078   *
079   * @threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by
080   * multiple threads, but the {@link #get()} method may not be, and
081   * the {@link Function#apply(Object)} method of the supplied {@code
082   * handler} may not be.
083   */
084  @OverridingDiscouraged
085  public default T exceptionally(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
086    try {
087      return this.get();
088    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
089      return handler.apply(e);
090    }
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Invokes the {@link Optional#filter(Predicate)} method on the
095   * return value of the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with
096   * the supplied {@code predicate}, and returns the result.
097   *
098   * @param predicate the {@link Predicate} in question; must not be
099   * {@code null}
100   *
101   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
102   * Optional#filter(Predicate)} method on the return value of the
103   * {@link #optional()} method with the supplied {@code predicate};
104   * never {@code null}
105   *
106   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
107   *
108   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
109   *
110   * @threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by
111   * multiple threads, but the {@link Predicate#test(Object)} method
112   * of the supplied {@code predicate} may not be
113   *
114   * @see #optional()
115   *
116   * @see Optional#filter(Predicate)
117   */
118  @Convenience
119  @OverridingDiscouraged
120  public default Optional<T> filter(final Predicate<? super T> predicate) {
121    return this.optional().filter(predicate);
122  }
123
124  /**
125   * Invokes the {@link Optional#flatMap(Function)} method on the
126   * return value of the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with
127   * the supplied {@code mapper}, and returns the result.
128   *
129   * @param <U> the mapped type
130   *
131   * @param mapper the {@link Function} performing the flat mapping
132   * operation; must not be {@code null}
133   *
134   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
135   * Optional#flatMap(Function)} method on the return value of the
136   * {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with the supplied {@code
137   * mapper}; never {@code null}
138   *
139   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
140   *
141   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
142   *
143   * @threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by
144   * multiple threads, but the {@link Predicate#test(Object)} method
145   * of the supplied {@code predicate} may not be
146   *
147   * @see #optional()
148   *
149   * @see Optional#flatMap(Function)
150   */
151  @Convenience
152  @OverridingDiscouraged
153  public default <U> Optional<U> flatMap(final Function<? super T, ? extends Optional<? extends U>> mapper) {
154    return this.optional().flatMap(mapper);
155  }
156
157  /**
158   * Returns a value, which may be {@code null}, indicating (possibly
159   * transitory) <em>emptiness</em>, or non-{@code null}, indicating
160   * (possibly transitory) <em>presence</em>.
161   *
162   * <p>This method's contract extends {@link Supplier#get()}'s
163   * contract with the following additional requirements:</p>
164   *
165   * <ul>
166   *
167   * <li>An implementation of this method need not be deterministic.</li>
168   *
169   * <li>An implementation of this method may indicate (possibly
170   * transitory) emptiness by any of the following means:
171   *
172   * <ul><li>Returning {@code null}.  The emptiness is
173   * <em>transitory</em>, i.e. a subsequent invocation of this method
174   * may return a non-{@code null} result.</li>
175   *
176   * <li>Throwing a {@link NoSuchElementException}.  The emptiness is
177   * <em>permanent</em>, i.e. all subsequent invocations of this
178   * method will (must) also throw an {@link
179   * NoSuchElementException}.</li>
180   *
181   * <li>Throwing an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}.  The
182   * emptiness is <em>permanent</em>, i.e. all subsequent invocations
183   * of this method will (must) also throw an {@link
184   * UnsupportedOperationException}.</li>
185   *
186   * </ul></li>
187   *
188   * <li>The returning of a non-{@code null} value indicates (only)
189   * <em>transitory presence</em>, i.e. a subsequent invocation of
190   * this method may return {@code null} or throw either a {@link
191   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
192   * UnsupportedOperationException}.</li>
193   *
194   * </ul>
195   *
196   * @return a value, or {@code null} to indicate transitory emptiness
197   *
198   * @exception NoSuchElementException to indicate permanent emptiness
199   *
200   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException to indicate permanent
201   * emptiness
202   *
203   * @nullability Implementations of this method may and often will
204   * return {@code null}, indicating transitory emptiness.
205   *
206   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
207   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
208   *
209   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
210   * but need not be deterministic.  However, once an implementation
211   * of this method throws either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or
212   * an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, it must also do so for
213   * every subsequent invocation.
214   */
215  @Override
216  public T get();
217
218  /**
219   * Invokes the {@link #get()} method and handles either the result
220   * or any {@link RuntimeException}s that are thrown using the
221   * supplied {@link BiFunction}.
222   *
223   * <p>The first argument to the handler will be the return value of
224   * the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code null}.  The second
225   * argument to the handler will be any {@link RuntimeException} that
226   * was thrown during the invocation of the {@link #get()}
227   * method.</p>
228   *
229   * @param <U> the type of the value returned
230   *
231   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
232   *
233   * @return the return value of the supplied {@code handler}'s {@link
234   * BiFunction#apply(Object, Object)} method, which may be {@code
235   * null}
236   *
237   * @nullability The default implementation of this method and its
238   * overrides may return {@code null}.
239   *
240   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
241   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
242   *
243   * @idempotency No guarantees about either idempotency or
244   * determinism are made.
245   */
246  @OverridingDiscouraged
247  public default <U> U handle(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
248    T value = null;
249    try {
250      value = this.get();
251    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
252      return handler.apply(null, e);
253    }
254    return handler.apply(value, null);
255  }
256
257  /**
258   * Invokes the {@link Optional#ifPresent(Consumer)} method on the return
259   * value of the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with the
260   * supplied {@code action}, and returns the result.
261   *
262   * @param action the {@link Consumer} representing the action to
263   * take; must not be {@code null}
264   *
265   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} is {@code null}
266   *
267   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
268   * idempotent and deterministic, but the supplied {@link Consumer}
269   * may not be.
270   *
271   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
272   * concurrent use by multiple threads, but the supplied {@link
273   * Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)} method may not be
274   *
275   * @see #optional()
276   *
277   * @see Optional#ifPresent(Consumer)
278   */
279  @Convenience
280  @OverridingDiscouraged
281  public default void ifPresent(final Consumer<? super T> action) {
282    this.optional().ifPresent(action);
283  }
284
285  /**
286   * Invokes the {@link Optional#ifPresentOrElse(Consumer, Runnable)}
287   * method on the return value of the {@link #optional()} method,
288   * supplying it with the supplied {@code action} and {@code
289   * emptyAction}, and returns the result.
290   *
291   * @param action the {@link Consumer} representing the action to
292   * take if a value is present; must not be {@code null}
293   *
294   * @param emptyAction the {@link Runnable} representing the action to
295   * take if a value is absent; must not be {@code null}
296   *
297   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} or {@code
298   * emptyAction} is {@code null}
299   *
300   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
301   * idempotent and deterministic, but the supplied {@link Consumer}
302   * and {@link Runnable} may not be.
303   *
304   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
305   * concurrent use by multiple threads, but the supplied {@link
306   * Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)} method may not be and
307   * the supplied {@link Runnable}'s {@link Runnable#run()} method may
308   * not be
309   *
310   * @see #optional()
311   *
312   * @see Optional#ifPresentOrElse(Consumer, Runnable)
313   */
314  @Convenience
315  @OverridingDiscouraged
316  public default void ifPresentOrElse(final Consumer<? super T> action, final Runnable emptyAction) {
317    this.optional().ifPresentOrElse(action, emptyAction);
318  }
319
320  /**
321   * Invokes the {@link Optional#map(Function)} method on the return
322   * value of the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with the
323   * supplied {@code mapper}, and returns an {@link Optional}
324   * representing the result.
325   *
326   * @param <U> the mapped type
327   *
328   * @param mapper the {@link Function} performing the mapping
329   * operation; must not be {@code null}
330   *
331   * @return an {@link Optional} representing the result of invoking
332   * the {@link Optional#map(Function)} method on the return value of
333   * the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with the supplied
334   * {@code mapper}; never {@code null}
335   *
336   * @nullability This method never returns, and its overrides must
337   * never return, {@code null}.
338   *
339   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
340   * idempotent and deterministic.
341   *
342   * @threadsafety This method itself is, and its overrides must be,
343   * safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the {@link
344   * Function#apply(Object)} method of the supplied {@code mapper} may
345   * not be
346   *
347   * @see #optional()
348   *
349   * @see Optional#map(Function)
350   */
351  @Convenience
352  @OverridingDiscouraged
353  public default <U> Optional<U> map(final Function <? super T, ? extends U> mapper) {
354    return this.optional().map(mapper);
355  }
356
357  /**
358   * Returns a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
359   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
360   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}.
361   *
362   * <p>The default implementation of this method does not and its
363   * overrides must not return {@code null}.</p>
364   *
365   * <p>The default implementation of this method catches all {@link
366   * NoSuchElementException}s and {@link
367   * UnsupportedOperationException}s and returns an empty {@link
368   * Optional} in these cases.  To detect permanent versus transitory
369   * emptiness, potential callers should use the {@link #get()} method
370   * directly or either the {@link #optional(Function)} or {@link
371   * #optional(BiFunction)} methods.</p>
372   *
373   * @return a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
374   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
375   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}
376   *
377   * @nullability The default implementation of this method does not
378   * and overrides must not return {@code null}.
379   *
380   * @threadsafety The default implementation of this method is and
381   * overrides must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
382   *
383   * @idempotency The default implementation and overrides of this
384   * method may not be idempotent or deterministic.
385   *
386   * @see #optional(BiFunction)
387   *
388   * @see #get()
389   */
390  @Convenience
391  @OverridingDiscouraged
392  public default Optional<T> optional() {
393    return this.optional(OptionalSupplier::returnNull);
394  }
395
396  /**
397   * Invokes the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method, supplying it with
398   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to the
399   * {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
400   * result.
401   *
402   * @param <U> the type of the returned {@link Optional}
403   *
404   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
405   *
406   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
407   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
408   * value of invoking the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method with the
409   * supplied {@code handler}
410   *
411   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
412   * null}
413   *
414   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
415   * return {@code null}.
416   *
417   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
418   * idempotent and deterministic.
419   *
420   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
421   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
422   *
423   * @see #handle(BiFunction)
424   *
425   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
426   */
427  @Convenience
428  @OverridingDiscouraged
429  public default <U> Optional<U> optional(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
430    return Optional.ofNullable(this.handle(handler));
431  }
432
433  /**
434   * Invokes the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method, supplying it
435   * with the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to
436   * the {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
437   * result.
438   *
439   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
440   *
441   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
442   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
443   * value of invoking the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method
444   * with the supplied {@code handler}
445   *
446   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
447   * null}
448   *
449   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
450   * return {@code null}.
451   *
452   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
453   * idempotent and deterministic.
454   *
455   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
456   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
457   *
458   * @see #exceptionally(Function)
459   *
460   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
461   */
462  @Convenience
463  @OverridingDiscouraged
464  public default Optional<T> optional(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
465    return Optional.ofNullable(this.exceptionally(handler));
466  }
467
468  /**
469   * Invokes the {@link Optional#or(Supplier)} method on the return
470   * value of the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with the
471   * supplied {@code supplier}, and returns the result.
472   *
473   * @param supplier the {@link Supplier} providing the alternate
474   * {@link Optional}; must not be {@code null}
475   *
476   * @return the result of invoking the {@link Optional#or(Supplier)}
477   * method on the return value of the {@link #optional()} method,
478   * supplying it with the supplied {@code supplier}; never {@code
479   * null}
480   *
481   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code null}
482   *
483   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
484   *
485   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
486   *
487   * @threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by
488   * multiple threads, but the {@link Supplier#get()} method of the
489   * supplied {@code supplier} may not be
490   *
491   * @see #optional()
492   *
493   * @see Optional#or(Supplier)
494   */
495  @Convenience
496  @OverridingDiscouraged
497  public default Optional<T> or(final Supplier<? extends Optional<? extends T>> supplier) {
498    return this.optional().or(supplier);
499  }
500
501  /**
502   * Invokes the {@link Optional#orElse(Object)} method on the return
503   * value of the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with the
504   * supplied {@code other}, and returns the result.
505   *
506   * @param other the alternate value; may be {@code null}
507   *
508   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
509   * Optional#orElse(Object)} method on the return value of the {@link
510   * #optional()} method, supplying it with the supplied {@code
511   * other}
512   *
513   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
514   *
515   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
516   *
517   * @threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by
518   * multiple threads, but the {@link Supplier#get()} method of the
519   * supplied {@code supplier} may not be
520   *
521   * @see #optional()
522   *
523   * @see Optional#orElse(Object)
524   */
525  @Convenience
526  @OverridingDiscouraged
527  public default T orElse(final T other) {
528    return this.optional().orElse(other);
529  }
530
531  /**
532   * Invokes the {@link Optional#orElseGet(Supplier)} method on the
533   * return value of the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with
534   * the supplied {@code supplier}, and returns the result.
535   *
536   * @param supplier the alternate value {@link Supplier}; must not be
537   * {@code null}
538   *
539   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
540   * Optional#orElseGet(Supplier)} method on the return value of the
541   * {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with the supplied {@code
542   * supplier}
543   *
544   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
545   * null}
546   *
547   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
548   *
549   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
550   *
551   * @threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by
552   * multiple threads, but the {@link Supplier#get()} method of the
553   * supplied {@code supplier} may not be
554   *
555   * @see #optional()
556   *
557   * @see Optional#orElseGet(Supplier)
558   */
559  @Convenience
560  @OverridingDiscouraged
561  public default T orElseGet(final Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
562    return this.optional().orElseGet(supplier);
563  }
564
565  /**
566   * Invokes the {@link #orElseThrow(Supplier)} method with {@link
567   * NoSuchElementException#NoSuchElementException()
568   * NoSuchElementException::new} and returns the result.
569   *
570   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #orElseThrow(Supplier)}
571   * method with {@link
572   * NoSuchElementException#NoSuchElementException()
573   * NoSuchElementException::new}
574   *
575   * @exception NoSuchElementException if the {@link #optional()}
576   * method returns an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link
577   * Optional}
578   *
579   * @nullability This method never returns, and its overrides must
580   * never return, {@code null}.
581   *
582   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be, as
583   * idempotent and deterministic as the {@link #optional()} method.
584   *
585   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
586   * concurrent use by multiple threads
587   *
588   * @see #orElseThrow(Supplier)
589   */
590  @Convenience
591  @OverridingDiscouraged
592  public default T orElseThrow() {
593    return this.orElseThrow(NoSuchElementException::new);
594  }
595
596  /**
597   * Invokes the {@link Optional#orElseThrow(Supplier)} method on the
598   * return value of the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with
599   * the supplied {@code throwableSupplier}, and returns the result.
600   *
601   * @param <X> the type of {@link Throwable} the supplied {@code
602   * throwableSupplier} {@linkplain Supplier#get() supplies}
603   *
604   * @param throwableSupplier the {@link Throwable} {@link Supplier};
605   * must not be {@code null}
606   *
607   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
608   * Optional#orElseThrow(Supplier)} method on the return value of the
609   * {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with the supplied {@code
610   * throwableSupplier}
611   *
612   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
613   * null}
614   *
615   * @exception X (actually {@code <X>}) if the {@link
616   * #optional()} method returns an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty()
617   * empty} {@link Optional} and the {@link
618   * Optional#orElseThrow(Supplier)} method throws an exception
619   *
620   * @nullability This method never returns, and its overrides must
621   * never return, {@code null}.
622   *
623   * @idempotency This method is and its overrides must be idempotent
624   * and deterministic.
625   *
626   * @threadsafety This method itself is, and its overrides must be,
627   * safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
628   *
629   * @see #optional()
630   *
631   * @see Optional#orElseThrow(Supplier)
632   */
633  @Convenience
634  @OverridingDiscouraged
635  public default <X extends Throwable> T orElseThrow(final Supplier<? extends X> throwableSupplier) throws X {
636    return this.optional().orElseThrow(throwableSupplier);
637  }
638
639  /**
640   * Invokes the {@link Optional#stream()} method on the return value
641   * of the {@link #optional()} method, and returns the result.
642   *
643   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
644   * Optional#stream()} method on the return value of the
645   * {@link #optional()} method
646   *
647   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
648   * return {@code null}.
649   *
650   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
651   * idempotent and deterministic.
652   *
653   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
654   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
655   *
656   * @see #optional()
657   *
658   * @see Optional#stream()
659   */
660  @Convenience
661  @OverridingDiscouraged
662  public default Stream<T> stream() {
663    return this.optional().stream();
664  }
665
666  private static <T> T returnNull(final RuntimeException e) {
667    if (e instanceof NoSuchElementException || e instanceof UnsupportedOperationException) {
668      return null;
669    } else {
670      throw e;
671    }
672  }
673
674}
